titlestmt.subtitle: Finding Aid
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Elisha Winkler.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in NoteTab Pro. Encoded by Deborah A. Richards. 2006-09-27

did.head: Collection Overview
did.abstract: This collection is in five folders and contains black and white photographs, course syllabi, mid-year and final exam questions, news releases, and newspaper articles.

bioghist.p: The Russian Department at Smith College began as the Polish and Russian Languages Department in 1941. By the 1942-1943 academic year, it was named the Slavic Languages Department. Since 1948-1949, it has been known as the Russian Language and Literature Department.

scopecontent.p: The Russian Department records contain materials describing the department, its courses, and its Russian Club. Types of materials include black and white photographs, course syllabi, mid-year and final exam questions, news releases, and newspaper articles.

accessrestrict.p: The records are open for research according to the regulations of the Smith College Archives without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the documents must be requested from the Smith College Archives. Smith College owns copyright to any published material relating to college events and activities. Provenance and copyright ownership of other materials is unknown and researchers are responsible for determining any question of copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Smith College Dept. of Russian, Box #, Smith College Archives.

acqinfo.p: The Russian Department records were created by the department and transferred to the College Archives.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Researchers should also view: 42. Faculty and 88A-126. Departmental correspondence, minutes, budget, personnel files, 1975-1985 [Unprocessed/portions restricted]
